title: Image Serving HTTP protocol command overview
description: The commands supported by Image Serving are listed below, grouped by rough category. Refer to the specific command descriptions for details regarding use and applicability.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Request commands
description: These commands apply regardless of where in the request they appear.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: View commands
description: These commands apply regardless of where in the request they appear.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Common operations
description: These commands apply to image, text and solid color layers. They are also generally useful for composite images and simple, non-layered image requests.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Source image operations
description: These commands apply to source images used either in simple requests or in image layers, as well as to masks attached to solid color layers.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Common layer commands
description: These commands apply to image, text, and solid color layers. Most are not meaningful for the composite image and for simple, non-layered requests. They do not apply to effect layers.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Image layer commands
description: These commands apply to image layers, in addition to the common layer commands.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Text layer commands
description: These commands apply to text layers, in addition to the common layer commands.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Solid color layer commands
description: These commands apply to solid color layers, in addition to the common layer commands.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Layer effect commands
description: These commands can be used to define layer effects, such as drop shadow or glow effects. Effect layers ignore all other commands.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Layering overview
description: Image Serving allows combining any number of image, text, and solid color layers into a composite image.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Specifying layers
description: In the URL or catalog Modifier command sequence, a layer definition sequence starts with the layer= command and terminates with another layer= command, an effect= command, or the end of the URL.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Layer order
description: The layer number also determines the z-order.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Layer types
description: Four types of layers are supported.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: The compositing canvas
description: Layers are composited in the order specified by the layer= command, where higher-numbered layers hide lower-numbered ones.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Layer operations
description: In addition to sizing (size=) and positioning (pos=) layers relative to layer 0 and specifying the compositing order (the z-order) with the layer= command, layers can be rotated (rotate=) and flipped (flip=).
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Named layers
description: The layer= command allows assigning a name to a layer and later reference the same layer by name rather than layer number.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Layer effects
description: Photoshop-style layer shadow and glow effects are implemented using special sub-layers (effect layers) which can be attached to any layer (the parent layer), including layer=0 and layer=comp.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Request nesting and embedding
description: Image Serving supports unlimited nesting of Image Serving requests, embedding of Image Rendering requests, as well as embedding images retrieved from foreign servers. Only layer images and layer masks support these mechanisms.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Substitution variables
description: Substitution variables are used to transfer values from the request URL to compositing templates stored in image catalogs. Variables can also be used to convey the same value to different places in a complex request.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Command macros
description: Command macros provide named shortcuts for sets of commands. Macros are defined in separate macro definition files, which can be attached to image catalogs or the default catalog.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Image catalogs
description: The features and syntax of image catalogs are described in this section.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Object ID translation
description: Image Serving provides a mechanism to translate external object ids to locale-specific object (catalog) IDs. The primary application is for providing locale-specific content and content shared amongst multiple locales without the client application needing to know the locale-specific object IDs.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Text string localization
description: Text string localization allows image catalogs to contain multiple locale-specific representations for the same string value.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: SVG support
description: Image Serving supports Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) files as source data. Conformance with SVG 1.1 is required.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Request preprocessing
description: Image Serving provides a simple request preprocessor based on regular-expression match and substitution rules.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Image maps
description: IS provides mechanisms to simplify use of HTML image maps. The JAVA-based and Flash-based viewers in IS also include limited support for image maps.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Image Serving color management
description: Image Serving supports color space conversions based on color space profiles conforming to the ICC (International Color Consortium) specification.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Image Serving HTTP encoding
description: Command values must be http-encoded using %xx escape sequences, such that the value strings do not include the reserved characters '=', '&', and '%'.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Request locking
description: To reduce opportunity for tampering with requests, a simple locking facility is provided.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Request obfuscation
description: The contents of the entire modifiers part of request string, including the optional lock suffix may be obscured by applying standard base64 encoding.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Watermarks
description: Image Serving implements a simple visual watermarking facility.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Serving static (non-image) content
description: Serving static (non-image) content
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Media set requests
description: Image Serving provides a mechanism for fetching a hierarchial text response (xml or json) which represents all of the resources and metadata associated with catalog ImageSet for a particular record.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Text formatting
description: Image Serving provides several alternatives to render text, accessible with the text= and textPs= commands.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Font handling
description: All fonts referenced in the RTF string must be available in the font map file of the default catalog or the current image catalog, otherwise an error is returned.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Color handling
description: The RTF specification permits RGB color values specified with \colortbl. Each component is provided separately with the \red, \green, and \blue commands.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Copy-fitting
description: textPs= implements a proprietary copy-fitting algorithm which will automatically adjust the font size(s) to optimally fill the text area with text, minimizing extra space at the bottom while avoiding overflow.

title: Text layers
description: textPs= supports a number of different usage models described in this section.

title: Text positioning
description: The text= renderer positions text fundamentally different than the textPs= renderer when applied to pre-sized layers (i.e. when size= is specified as well).

title: color
description: Color Values. You can specify color values using either hexadecimal notation, a comma-separated list of component values, or decimals.

title: coord
description: Pixel Coordinates. Used to specify image coordinates, such as image offsets or crop parameters, in form of a pixel offset relative to the top-left corner of an image or layer rectangle.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: coordN
description: Normalized Coordinates. Used to specify relative positions within an image, such as image offsets or crop parameters, normalized to the size of the image.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: object
description: Source Object Specifier. Image, SVG, and ICC profile objects may be specified as image catalog entries or relative file paths
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: size
description: Pixel Size. Used to specify image sizes or rectangle sizes in pixels.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: sizeN
description: Normalized Size. Used to specify image sizes or rectangle sizes, normalized relative to the size of layer 0 or some other image.

title: Command reference
description: This section describes the HTTP protocol commands.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: align
description: Align Image with View. Aligns the composite image (possibly after scaling, if scl= is specified as well) within the view rectangle defined by wid= and hei=.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: anchor
description: Image Anchor. Defines the anchor point of the image, solid color, or text bounding box rectangle, before applying transforms (crop=, scale=, rotate=, flip=). Also serves as the center-of-rotation for rotate=.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: bfc
description: Browser Format Conversion. Specifies whether browser format conversion functionality is turned on or off.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: bgc
description: View Background Color. Specifies the background color for the composite image (view image).
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: bgColor
description: Layer Background Color. Specifies the background color and opacity of the current layer.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: blendMode
description: Blend Mode. Specifies the type of blending used when the layer is composited. Simulates commonly used blend modes available in Photoshop. Refer to Photoshop documentation for details.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: cache
description: Cache Control. Allows selectively disabling client-side caching (browser, proxy servers, network caching systems) and caching in the internal Platform Server cache.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: clipPath
description: Layer Clip Path. Specifies a clip path for the current layer.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: clipXPath
description: Inverted Layer Clip Path. Specifies an exclusion clip path for the current layer. Any parts of the layer that are within the area defined by clipXPath= are rendered transparent.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: color
description: Layer Color. Specifies the foreground color and opacity of solid color and effect layers, and the text box fill color for text layers.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: crop
description: Crop Image. Specifies a rectangular crop region, expressed either in pixels or normalized relative to the full-resolution source image or mask image.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: cropPathE
description: Lets you crop to the bounding box of an embedded named path. This cropping, in turn, changes the size of the image.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: defaultImage
description: Default Reply Image. Specifies the image or catalog entry to be used when an image cannot be found.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: effect
description: Select Effect Layer. Selects an effect layer and starts a new layer segment in the request string, which is associated with the current layer.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: effectMask
description: Overrides the value of attribute ApplyEffectMask for the request.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: extend
description: Extend layer. Adds margins to a layer or crops the layer rectangle.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: fit
description: Response Image Fit Mode. Specifies how the scale factor is calculated, which is used to scale the composite image to the response image when the response size is specified with wid= and hei= and scl= is not present.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: flip
description: Flip Layer. Flips the layer horizontally, vertically, or both, after applying crop= and before rotate= and extend=.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: fmt
description: Response Image Format.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: hei
description: View Height. Specifies the height of the response image (view image) when fit is not present in the request.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: hide
description: Hide Layer. Allows hiding a layer without removing it from the request string.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: icc
description: Output Color Profile.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: iccEmbed
description: Embed Color Profile. Specifies whether the working ICC color profile or the profile specified with icc= should be embedded in the reply image.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: id
description: Image/Metadata Version. When working with content that changes frequently, servers in caching networks such as Akamai, browser caches, and corporate proxy server caches may store Image Serving responses which may be out of date for periods of time.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: imageSet
description: Image Set. Specifies an image set value for use when generating req=set response.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: jpegSize
description: Jpeg Size in KiloBytes. Specifies the maximum size of the JPEG response in kilobytes.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: layer
description: Select Layer. Selects a layer and starts a new layer definition segment in the command sequence.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: locale
description: Translation Locale Id. Specifies the locale id for the request.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: map
description: Image Map Data. Provides image map data for this layer. Overrides any data from catalog Map for this layer.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: mask
description: Image mask. Specifies a separate mask image to be used as an unassociated mask.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: maskUse
description: Image mask usage. Specifies how the mask or alpha channel of the image is used for operations on the image (for example, colorize=). When specified in an effect layer, it allows applying the effect to the background area of parent layer or to the entire parent layer rectangle.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: op_blur
description: Blur image. Applies a blur filter to the image data.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: op_brightness
description: Adjust brightness. Decreases or increases the image brightness.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: op_colorbalance
description: Adjust color balance. Adjusts the value of each RGB color component separately.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: op_colorize
description: Colorize image. Colorizes the image data while preserving shadows and highlights.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: op_contrast
description: Adjust contrast. Adjusts the image contrast by increasing the brightness of pixels with more than 50% brightness, and reducing the brightness of pixels with less than 50% brightness.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: op_grow
description: Dilate/erode image. Applies a morphological dilate (radius > 0) or erode (radius < 0) to the image data.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: op_growMask
description: Dilate/erode image. Applies a morphological dilate (radius > 0) or erode (radius < 0) to the mask data.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: op_growMaskR
description: Dilate/erode image. Applies a morphological dilate (radius > 0) or erode (radius < 0) to the mask data.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: op_hue

title: Vignettes
description: Vignettes are images authored with Dynamic Media Image Authoring for use with Image Rendering.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Scene coordinates
description: The scene coordinate space is used to specify sizes of and distances on the texturable object surfaces.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Material resolution
description: The resolution value of a repeatable texture or other material defines the size of the material image in the scene coordinate space.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Materials
description: Image Rendering applies materials to groups or objects in vignettes.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Solid colors
description: This material category includes paints for walls, woodwork and trim, automotive, as well as any other application where textures are not required.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Repeatable textures
description: Repeatable textures include interior and exterior materials, such as fabrics (both apparel and upholstery), wall-to-wall floor coverings, wallpapers, countertop materials, wood grain textures, roofing and siding materials, and any other generic texture.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Wall borders
description: A material is considered a wall border when it is specified in a wall border MSS (introduced with sub=3..5).
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Decals
description: Decal materials include apparel constructs such as appliqués, t-shirt prints, and embroidered or printed logos, as well as non-repeatable, flat objects used in interior or exterior applications, such as area rugs, wall-hung art, signs, and so on.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Cabinets
description: Cabinets materials specify a cabinet style file (.vnc file extension), a special data file containing photographic representations of cabinets together with parametric layout definitions and other information required for rendering cabinet fronts.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Window coverings
description: Window covering materials include both soft window coverings (drapes, valances, café curtains), as well as hard window coverings (shades and blinds).
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Advanced Render effects
description: Several advanced render effects are available.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Using multiple illumination maps
description: Some applications may require a different illumination map for different kinds of materials.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Colorizing materials
description: Most materials can be colorized dynamically.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Varying material opacity
description: Variable opacity is supported for solid color and repeatable textures applied to overlapping objects, as well as for decals and window covering materials.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Reflections
description: Vignettes can be authored to include near-3D reflection data.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Gloss effects
description: If so enabled in the vignette, the renderer will vary the illumination algorithm to simulate a variation of the material glossiness (chiefly by controlling contrast).
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Advanced Render settings
description: The Vignette Authoring Tool (part of the Dynamic Media Image Authoring package) provides mechanisms to control low-level aspects of the vignette render engine.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Nested Image Rendering requests

title: Foreign image sources

topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

description: Error message detail. Specifies the level of detail for error messages returned via HTTP as the error.message value.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: Expiration
description: Default client cache time to live. Provides a default expiration interval in case a particular catalog record does not contain a valid catalog Expiration or vignette Expiration value, or if a vignette file or material file is accessed directly, rather than via a catalog record.

title: Format
description: Default reply image format. Specifies the default format for reply images.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

description: Blackpoint compensation. Specifies whether blackpoint compensation should be applied to color conversions when no explicit selection is made with icc=.

title: IccDither
description: Color conversion dithering. Specifies whether dithering should be used to improve the perceptual quality of color conversions when no explicit selection is made with icc=.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: IccProfileCmyk
description: CMYK default color space. Specifies the name of the ICC color profile to be used for gray-scale response images when no output color space is specified with icc=.

title: IccProfileGray
description: Grayscale default color space. Specifies the name of the ICC color profile to be used for grayscale response images when no output color space is specified with icc=.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

description: ICC profile map file path. Specifies the file which contains the ICC profile map for this image catalog.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: IccProfileRgb
description: RGB default output color profile. Specifies the name of the ICC color profile to be used for RGB response images when no output color space is specified with icc= and for certain RGB color values specified with various Image Rendering commands, such as bgc= and color=.

description: Default advanced render settings. Default for catalog RenderSettings.

topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

title: RuleSetFile
description: Rule set definitions file path. Specifies the file which contains the rule set definitions for this material catalog.
topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API

topic: Dynamic Media Image Serving - Image Rendering API
